The Haynes/Torigoye copy is in a different hand.  I haven't seen a full version of anyone's copy in print.  I wonder how many different hand copies there are.

Jim



  David,

  Thank you! That was exactly what I recalled but could not place.

  Craig


  > No help on the Yagyu family pattern book but in
  > Selected Fine Japanese Swords from European NBTHK Collections there
  > is about 16 pages about Yagyu tsuba with image of
  > the real tsuba and the pattern from the family pattern book.
  > 
  > later
  > david
